div.div: While Apple's reported sell-out of initial stock suggests consumers may be enamored with the iPhone 5, not everyone is pleased as punch with their purchase.

div.a: Locals Convinced Found Remains Are King Richard III

div.div: As archaeologists leave the Leicester site where they believe they have found royal remains, locals are already convinced.

div.a: A Peek Inside Apple's A6 Processor

div.div: Apple Inc.'s A6—the processor powering its new iPhone 5—is likely fabricated by South Korea's Samsung Electronics Co. Ltd. and may employ ARM's "big-little" graphics processor core scheme.

div.a: How Collecting Opium Antiques Turned Me Into An Opium Addict

div.div: You really have to work hard to get hooked on smoking opium. The Victorian-era form of the drug, known as chandu, is rare, and the people who know how to use it aren’t exactly forthcoming. But leave it to an obsessive antiques collector to figure out how to get to addicted to a 19th-century drug.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PSVptN&via=Digg&text=How Collecting Opium Antiques Turned Me Into An Opium Addict

div.div: Today's young people could pay a high price pay at work or in health insurance for giving up their privacy online

div.a: Who Bought The First iPhone 5 And Other Weird Tales

div.div: The frenzy this weekend over the release of the iPhone 5 no doubt left both Apple and enthusiastic supporters of their devices happy with the end result. But a product that seems to literally drive people crazy is bound to cause a stir in some unexpected ways.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vx2T89&via=Digg&text=Who Bought The First iPhone 5 And Other Weird Tales

div.a: Facebook Shoots Down Reports Of Private Messages Breach

div.div: There was a big Facebook privacy scare today, when reports broke that old private messages were appearing on users' timelines.

div.div: A dolphin known as "Beggar" for his tendency to approach boaters for food has been found dead, possibly as a result of his poor diet.

div.a: How Liberal Arts Colleges Are Failing America

div.div: When are Americans going to wake up and realize that the 60s and 70s-era nostalgia for the "value" of a college degree is just that -- nostalgia?

div.div: What happens when muscular millionaires clash with brash billionaires? Professional athletics.

div.a: Father, Son Send Toy Train To Space

div.div: With the use of a weather balloon and a box that housed a mounted HD camera and an old cell phone for GPS, the toy train took an hour long trip to the stratosphere.
